title: mojo.openapi.SecurityScheme
description: Defines a security scheme that can be used by the operations. Supported schemes are HTTP authentication, an API key (either as a header or as a query parameter), OAuth2's common flows (implicit, password, application and access code) as defined in RFC6749, and OpenID Connect Discovery.

bearerFormat.title: mojo.core.String
bearerFormat.description: A hint to the client to identify how the bearer token is formatted. Bearer tokens are usually generated by an authorization server, so this information is primarily for documentation purposes.

in.title: mojo.core.String
in.description: The location of the API key. Valid values are "query", "header" or "cookie".

name.title: mojo.core.String
name.description: The name of the header, query or cookie parameter to be used.

scheme.title: mojo.core.String
scheme.description: The name of the HTTP Authorization scheme to be used in the Authorization header as defined in RFC7235.

type.title: mojo.openapi.SecurityScheme.Type
type.description: The type of the security scheme.
